pr_title: Add DeleteFile and manifest reader and writer for deletes

timeline.message: Extract ContentFile from DataFile and add type param to ManifestEntry.
Extract ContentFile from DataFile and add type param to ManifestEntry.

timeline.bodyText: I see the comment says that the BaseFile is the base class for DataFile and DeleteFile,  is it suitable to make the FileContent use FileContent.DATA by default ?  Just curious.
timeline.author: openinx

replies.bodyText: I am also curious whether we can rely on content() defined in ContentFile as both DeleteFile and DataFile override that.
replies.author: aokolnychyi

replies.bodyText: The FileContent for DeleteFile could be either POSITION_DELETES or EQUALITY_DELETES so we need to store it. DataFile always overrides it though.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: We actually need a field as DeleteFiles can be either positional or equality.
replies.author: aokolnychyi

timeline.bodyText: I guess we should return this.content.id() here ?
timeline.author: openinx

replies.bodyText: This is only used on read to get a container to reuse, so it doesn't affect correctness. Writes all go through the wrappers, which is why tests pass. I'll fix this to avoid confusion.
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Missing a FileContent field here I guess.
timeline.author: openinx
openinx

timeline.bodyText: For my understanding,  the DATA manifest & DELETE manifest could share the same read / write path so I think we could use the common reader+writer.  Is there any other reason that we need to make them separate paths ?
timeline.author: openinx

replies.bodyText: They have the same schema to keep the format simpler, but in the APIs we want to keep them separate by using DataFile and DeleteFile types. The readers and writers mostly share the same code, but are separate so that they can use the correct file type interface.
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Do we keep GenericDataFile on purpose here?
timeline.author: aokolnychyi

replies.bodyText: This is used by getSchema, which should probably be overridden. It doesn't matter for correctness, but it would be nice to use the right record name.
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: nit: I think this can be on a single line now (i.e. iterator())
timeline.author: aokolnychyi

timeline.message: Split DataFile into DataFile and DeleteFile.
Extract ContentFile from DataFile and add type param to ManifestEntry.
